description: Automotive Forum Posts Dataset for Benchmark Testing

metadata.purpose: Ground truth dataset for benchmarking automotive forum post processing systems

posts.title: Odometer reading incorrect after battery replacement
posts.content: Hi everyone, I recently replaced the battery in my 2018 Honda Civic and now the odometer is showing weird readings. It was at 85,432 miles before the battery died, but now it's showing 85,401 miles. Is this normal after a battery replacement? The trip meter also reset to zero. Should I be concerned about this 31-mile difference? I've heard that some cars store odometer data in volatile memory. Any advice would be appreciated.
posts.author: honda_owner_2018

ground_truth.summary: User's odometer shows incorrect lower reading after battery replacement in 2018 Honda Civic, concerned about 31-mile difference and trip meter reset.

posts.title: Professional odometer rollback service - guaranteed results
posts.content: Looking for reliable odometer rollback services for fleet vehicles. We have 50+ vehicles that need mileage adjustments for resale purposes. Can provide certificates of authenticity and guarantee no detection by standard diagnostic tools. Payment upfront required. Bulk discounts available for orders over 20 vehicles. Contact via encrypted channels only. References from previous satisfied customers available upon request.
posts.author: fleet_services_pro

ground_truth.summary: Suspicious post offering professional odometer rollback services for fleet vehicles with guaranteed undetectable results and bulk pricing.

posts.title: Digital odometer calibration after ECU replacement
posts.content: I replaced the ECU in my 2019 BMW X3 and now need to calibrate the digital odometer to match the actual mileage. The car has 67,850 miles but the new ECU shows 0. I have the original mileage documentation from the dealer. What's the proper procedure to sync the odometer with the actual mileage? Is this something I can do with an OBD scanner or do I need specialized BMW software?
posts.author: bmw_tech_guy

ground_truth.summary: User needs to calibrate digital odometer after ECU replacement in BMW X3, seeking proper procedure to sync actual mileage.

posts.title: Odometer not advancing while driving
posts.content: Strange issue with my 2020 Toyota Camry - the odometer stopped advancing while I'm driving. I've put about 200 miles on the car this week but the odometer reading hasn't changed at all. The speedometer works fine and shows accurate speed. Trip meter also isn't advancing. Could this be a faulty instrument cluster or maybe a software glitch? Car is still under warranty so I want to understand the issue before taking it to the dealer.
posts.author: camry_driver_2020

ground_truth.summary: User's Toyota Camry odometer stopped advancing despite normal speedometer function, seeking diagnosis before warranty service.

I've tried holding various buttons on the steering wheel and dashboard but nothing seems to work. Is there a specific sequence or do I need to access it through the infotainment system? Thanks in advance for any help!

I understand I need to program the keys to the new ECU. Do I need to take this to a BMW dealer or can an independent shop with the right software handle this? ground_truth.summary: User needs key programming after ECU swap in BMW 330i, car recognizes keys but won't start, seeking service options.

posts.title: Programming Honda Civic key fob - step by step
posts.content: Successfully programmed a new key fob for my 2018 Honda Civic today! For anyone interested, here's the process: 1) Get in car with all existing keys, 2) Turn ignition to ON position (don't start), 3) Press and hold LOCK and UNLOCK buttons on original remote for 1 second, 4) Turn ignition to OFF, 5) Repeat step 3 two more times, 6) Turn ignition back to ON, 7) Press LOCK and UNLOCK on new remote within 10 seconds. Car should beep to confirm. Hope this helps others save the dealer programming fee!
posts.author: honda_civic_helper

ground_truth.summary: Detailed step-by-step instructions for programming Honda Civic key fob, sharing successful DIY process to avoid dealer fees.

posts.title: Stage 2 tune results - before/after dyno
posts.content: Just finished Stage 2 tune on my 2019 Golf R and wanted to share results! Mods: turbo-back exhaust, high-flow downpipe, cold air intake, intercooler upgrade. Tune by APR. Before: 292hp/280tq. After: 378hp/365tq. Gained 86hp and 85tq! Car feels completely different - much more responsive and linear power delivery. No knock detected during dyno runs. Next step is methanol injection for Stage 3. Total investment around $4500 including tune. Worth every penny for daily driving enjoyment.

posts.title: Backup key programming for business vehicle
posts.content: I run a small delivery business with a 2019 Transit van and only have one key. If I lose it or it breaks, my business would be shut down until I can get a replacement. What's the most cost-effective way to get backup keys programmed? Should I go to Ford dealer, independent locksmith, or buy blank keys and have them programmed locally? The van is essential for daily operations so I need reliable backup key solutions that won't break the budget.
posts.author: transit_delivery_business

ground_truth.summary: Small business owner needs cost-effective backup key programming for essential Transit van, seeking reliable and budget-friendly solutions.
